intro: Melandrium saxatile, commonly known as the rock catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers with five petals, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, and it is often found in dry, open habitats. Melandrium saxatile is also known for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
